Name: Man sitting on a cubic seat
Description: This limestone statuette comes from the excavations of J. Garstang at Abydos. It represents a man in a short kilt, sitting on a cubic seat, the hands placed on the knees. He wears a long hairstyle of which two locks cover the shoulders. At the neck, one notices a large necklace of a round form. The piece, which is a good state of preservation and which does not carry any inscription, dates from the Old Kingdom.
